result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Lorenzo Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: consecutive to any other sentence, straight time.

miscConds.notes:
Court set restitution at zero as to both cases.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges as to both cases.
All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

No contact with MDW without written consent by the victim and permission from the PO agent.
Court ordered no contact with victim for at least 9 months from today's date.

AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatments.
Absolute sobriety with random testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Lorenzo Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 2:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded on this case and on 22CM560 with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
As to 22CM559 - Serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, straight time
As to 22CM560 - Serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, straight time
Credit for 1 day time served on 22CM559
Court stayed the sentences and placed defendant on 16 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- AODA assessment and follow any recommeded treatments
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no contact with MDW without written consent by the victim and permission from the PO agent.  Court ordered no contact with victim for at least 9 months from today's date.

Court set restitution at zero as to both cases. 
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges as to both cases.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

Appeal rights given
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Received and Filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Anthony Lorenzo Wilson not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Anthony Lorenzo Wilson not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Court waives defendant's appearance.
Defense counsel advises the Court they are in receipt of discovery and offer and request an adjournment to allow time to review with client.
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  releasing hold and being allowed to work again.  (Anthony L. Wilson, Washington County Jail, 500 Rolfs Ave, West Bend WI 53090).

Court ordered no contact with Mary W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony Lorenzo Wilson in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Anthony Lorenzo Wilson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Lorenzo Wilson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  clearing open warrant on this case.  (Anthony L. Wilson, Washington County Jail, 500 Rolfs Ave, West Bend WI 53090).
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Anthony Lorenzo Wilson not in court.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/25/22 @ 2p
